bibl.title: (Dis)located Spaces and Mediated Oppositions: Monks and Bedouin in the Deserts Around the Red Sea.
Navigated Spaces, Connected Places. Proceedings of Red Sea Project V Held at the University of Exeter, 16-19 September 2010.

bibl.note: Introduction. - The monasteries. - The monasteries in the Eastern Desert. - Christian sites in Sinai. - Desert dwellers: The ethnic other. - Holy relics, wall paintings - and the Red Sea. - Monks, fish and the Red Sea. - Conclusions.
bibl.seg: Janet C.M. Starkey, (Dis)located Spaces and Mediated Oppositions: Monks and Bedouin in the Deserts Around the Red Sea.

Dionisius A. Agius, John P. Cooper, Athena Trakadas & Chiara Zazzaro (edd.), Navigated Spaces, Connected Places. Proceedings of Red Sea Project V Held at the University of Exeter, 16-19 September 2010 = British Foundation for the Study of Arabia Monographs. 12 = BAR International Series. 2346 (Oxford, 2012) pp. 203-219, 1 carte, 9 figg.

Introduction. - The monasteries. - The monasteries in the Eastern Desert. - Christian sites in Sinai. - Desert dwellers: The ethnic other. - Holy relics, wall paintings - and the Red Sea. - Monks, fish and the Red Sea. - Conclusions.
